title: Short-Intensive Course for Developing Information Problem-Solving Skills (IPS) Based on the 4C/ID Model

context.prior_knowledge: Basic academic research skills and experience in writing scholarly papers
context.additional_context: Focus on enhancing problem-solving skills through academic text analysis in mathematics

learning_goals: Learners can systematically assess six core elements (approach, references, primary sources, in-text citations, writing style, new content generation) when analyzing academic texts.

Learners can apply the four components of the 4C/ID model (learning tasks, supportive information, part-task practice, coaching) to establish information problem-solving strategies when tackling complex mathematical problems.
Learners can enhance information integration and critical thinking skills by reconstructing real-world mathematical academic texts.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
